results.title: Femme fatale [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Marina Gefter, Tarak Ben Ammar and Quinta Communications
results.brief_description: Brian de Palma’s exciting and kinetic celebration of cinema has a frankly ludicrous plot involving diamond smugglers, a violent, beautiful and ruthless lesbian anti-heroine, and an audaciously over-the-top climax. But none of that matters for this strikingly shot film, beginning at the actual 2001 Cannes Film Festival and culminating in a breathlessly executed finale on the streets of Paris, is a joyful celebration of the possibilities of action cinema. De Palma has always been one of Hitchcock’s staunchest heirs and “Femme fatale” is a continuation of that master’s pleasure in creating a virtuoso cinema of spectacle, technique and purely cinematic language. From the sharpness of Bill Pankow’s editing to the sublime use of split-screen and subjective camera, from the clever pastiche of Ryuichi Sakamoto’s score to the crisp cinematography of Theirry Arbogast, “Femme fatale” is a film in love with cinema itself. Rebecca Romijn-Stamos makes for a suitably sexy and dangerous noir heroine; Antonio Banderas is the mug who falls in love with her; and there are guest cameos by Cannes Film Festival director, Gilles Jacob, by French director Regis Wargnier and French actress, Sandrine Bonnaire.

results.title: Felix the cat: the movie
results.creator_credit: Tibor Hernadi, Christian Schneider, Don Oriolo, James Schenk, Animation Film Cologne and Felix the Cat Creations
results.brief_description: The lovable Felix the Cat is back in a full-length movie to entertain and delight a new generation of young children as well as those who grew up with this famous cartoon cat. Join Felix in an adventure full of twists and turns as he is summoned to the golden Kingdom of Oriana, where the evil Duke Zill has just escaped exile and is plotting to turn the peaceful green land of Oriana into a profitable land, but one that will be an industrial nightmare. With his magical Bag of Tricks and the help of the beautiful Princess Oriana, Felix sets out to save the Kingdom from Zill and his mechanical troops. Based on an original story by Don Oriolo. Original Felix characters designed by Joe Oriolo.

results.title: Felix the Cat
results.brief_description: A bag of high flying adventure with Felix the Cat. See Felix pull all elevators and airplanes out of his magic bag of tricks and fly to the moon with Pointdexter. Watch Felix capture Rock Bottom and delight in the antics of the professor. It’s all here in an hour of fun! Rated: G

results.title: Feelings: what are you afraid of?
results.creator_credit: Abram Murray and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Helps the young viewer understand that everyone experiences fear at some time and that being afraid need not be a subject of embarrassment. Shows a number of children discussing their fears. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Feelings: don't stay mad
results.creator_credit: Abram Murray and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Discusses the fact that people should not let feelings grow until they are overwhelmed by them. Suggests that anger can be talked out or acted out in positive ways. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Feeling yes, feeling no. Parts 1, 2 and 3
results.creator_credit: Moira Simpson, Jennifer Torrance, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Feeling yes, feeling no Parts 1, 2 and 3 are part of a sexual assault prevention program for young children. The purpose of this video is to give children the skills necessary to protect themselves from sexual assault - from strangers, from family members, from other trusted people. Part 1 teaches children basic skills that build self-worth, self-confidence and good judgement. Part 2 reinforces the understanding of “Yes” feelings and “No” feelings and introduces skills to keep children assess potentially dangerous situations involving strangers. Part 3, introduces the issue of sexual assault by a trusted adult. Cast includes: Barbara Duncan, Fran Gebhard and Brian Torpe. (Awards: Montreal; Oakland; Mauriac)

results.title: Feeding and clothing China's millions
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This exotic film provides a detailed picture of a very different culture, a cooperative and conserver society of the North China plain. Life here revolves around agriculture—wheat, rice and cotton crops—and almost everyone is involved in their intense cultivation. A cotton factory in an industrial city reveals another link in China’s massive, coordinated efforts to ensure its people adequate food, clothing, shelter and jobs.

results.title: Fear and Fantasy (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
A psychological study of anxiety and prejudice. Highlights how anxiety is the root source of many prejudices and how group training procedures can provide personal insight into problems.

results.title: Gisser job (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
Psychological studies of people at work. Considers ways in which stress associated with unemployment and among working people may be reduced.
